definition: in simple terms/to put things simply/briefly
simple/uncomplicated/letter/to choose/to select/bamboo strips used for writing (old)

sentences.english: In short, they might make better ethical decisions than people.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，它們會比人類做出更恰當的道德判斷。

sentences.english: In short, our life has become comfortable and convenient.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，我們的生活變得舒適而方便。

sentences.english: In short, there is more to the equation than simply smoking and lung cancer.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，僅僅吸菸與得肺癌之間是不能簡單劃等號的。

sentences.english: In short, they find their work interesting.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，隱密直似有接受祕事之權也。

sentences.english: In short, the two traits go together.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，這兩項特性合而爲一了。

sentences.english: In short, you need proper governance.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，您需要適當的治理。

sentences.english: In short, it is all a big chocolate mess.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，現在是天下大亂。

sentences.english: In the short term, yes, but sleeping less probably won't help you lose weight.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，是的，但少睡並不能幫助你減肥。

sentences.english: Financial assets are simply a claim on goods and services.
sentences.chinese: 金融資產簡言之即對產品和服務的求償權。

sentences.english: Simply put, it is the use of 'rock instrumentation' for non-rock purposes.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，後搖就是用搖滾樂器來創造非搖滾。

sentences.english: In short the photographic exhibition can get the students to discover and appreciate beauty.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，攝影展能夠讓同學發現和欣賞美。

sentences.english: In short, I sing for fun.
In short, it means the ability graduate complete scientific research task successfully.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，指研究生順利完成科研活動任務所需的能力。

sentences.english: In short, reading is both an intellectual skill and also a meta-cognitive activity.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，閱讀既是智力技能，也是一種元認知活動。

sentences.english: In short, they affect the quality of your life.
sentences.chinese: 簡言之，這些想法影響你生活的質量。

sentences.english: It's a long letter; but in brief, he says "No".
sentences.chinese: 這是一封長信，但簡言之，他拒絕了。
